Event.name: Absorb_heat
Event.definition:
<def-root>An <fen>Entity</fen> (generally food) is exposed to a <fen>Heat_source</fen> whose <fen>Temperature</fen> may also be specified. Generally, the <fen>Entity</fen> undergoes some sort of change as a result of this process.
<ex><fex name="ent">Bacon</fex> was <t>frying</t> <fex name="Container">in the pan</fex>, and a great heap of eggs already lay steaming on a plate.</ex> <ex>If <fex name="ent">it</fex> <t>cooks</t> <fex name="tem">at 400</fex> <fex name="dur">for an hour</fex>, it 'll be nothing but a pile of ash!</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Entity
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Entity</fen> (often a food item) that absorbs heat.
<ex><fex name="Entity">Bacon</fex> <t>frying</t> in the pan and scenting the air </ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Container
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Container</fen> that holds the <fen>Entity</fen> that absorbs the heat.
<ex>Five fat sausages were <t>frying</t> <fex name="Container">in the pan</fex> </ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Heat_source
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the object that directly supplies heat to the <fen>Entity</fen>. <ex>Food was placed to <t>sizzle</t> <fex name="Heat_source">on the barbecue </fex>.</ex></def-root >

Arg.name: Place
Arg.definition:
<def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the heat application occurs.
<ex> <fex name="Place">In the kitchen</fex> the meat <t>sizzled</t> in the oven and a big pan of potatoes stood on the hob </ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Medium
Arg.definition:
<def-root><fen>Medium</fen> is a substance through which heat is absorbed by the <fen>Entity</fen>.
<ex>The golden meat was <t>simmering</t> <fex name="Medium">in a sauce that seemed lifted straight out of a French coq au vin rouge</fex></ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Manner
Arg.definition:
<def-root>Any description of the cooking event which is not covered by more specific FEs, including secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way).
<ex>Get them <t>frying</t> <fex name="Manner">slowly</fex>, iin a spoonful of olive oil.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Time
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Time</fen> when the heat absorption takes place.
<ex><fex name="Time">Five minutes ago</fex>the eggs weren't <t>boiling</t> yet.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Explanation
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The thing or state-of-affairs that leads to the <fen>Entity</fen> being heated and undergoing change.
<ex>The liquid nitrogen was <t>simmering</t> <fex name="Exp">from the heat</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Temperature
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The temperature that the <fen>Entity</fen> stays at, resulting in change.
<ex>No, that kind of batter should <t>bake</t> <fex name="tem">at a lower temperature</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Duration
Arg.definition: <def-root>The length of time that the <fen>Entity</fen> is exposed to heat.</def-root>

Arg.name: Circumstances
Arg.definition: <def-root>Circumstances describe the state of the world (at a particular time and place) which is specifically independent of the event itself and any of its participants. </def-root>

Arg.name: Purpose
Arg.definition: <def-root>The reason why a state of affairs is caused or maintained by an (implicit) agent. </def-root>

Arg.name: Depictive
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE describes the <fen>Entity</fen> as being in some state during the action. </def-root>

Arg.name: Result
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The final state of affairs after the absorbing heat event has finished.
<ex>The lobster <t>boiled</t> <fex name="Result">to death</fex>.</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: sizzle.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to make a hissing sound in or as if in roasting or frying

lexUnit.name: fry.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: be cooked in hot fat or oil, or get very hot by exposure to a heat source

lexUnit.name: bake.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to be cooked by dry heat, especially in an oven and as food

lexUnit.name: simmer.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to cook slowly in a liquid just below the boiling point in a closed dish or pan

lexUnit.name: cook.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: (of food) be heated so as to reach an edible state.

lexUnit.name: stew.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to become boiled slowly or by simmering heat

lexUnit.name: boil.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to be cooked by immersing in a boiling liquid

lexUnit.name: scorch.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: become burnt and crispy on the surface or edges.

lexUnit.name: sear.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: become burned by intense heat, usually from a metal Heat_source

lexUnit.name: singe.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: be burnt lightly or superficially, usually by a flame.

lexUnit.name: barbecue.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to cook on a grill

lexUnit.name: blanch.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to cook by being immersed for a short period of time in boiling water

lexUnit.name: braise.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to stew slowly after being lighly fried

lexUnit.name: broil.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to cook by being subjected to intense heat

lexUnit.name: brown.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to become brown as a result of cooking

lexUnit.name: char.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to become blacked by absorbing heat

lexUnit.name: coddle.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to become cooked by heating in water below the boiling point

lexUnit.name: deep fry.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to be cooked by immersion in heated oil

lexUnit.name: grill.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to cook on a grill

lexUnit.name: parboil.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to cook partially by being boiled

lexUnit.name: poach.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to become cooked by simmering in liquid

lexUnit.name: roast.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to be cooked by extended exposure to heat, usually in an oven or over a fire

lexUnit.name: saute.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to be fried lightly and quickly in hot oil or fat

lexUnit.name: steam.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to become heated as a result of the application of steam

lexUnit.name: toast.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to be cooked by exposure to radient heat
